conclusion: Liquid will flow out from spouts A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The image shows spouts labeled A, B, and C at the top, baffles positioned at various angles, and containers labeled D and E at the bottom.
Spout A is positioned on the left, spout B is in the middle, and spout C is on the right.
Container D is located on the left at the bottom, and container E is located on the right at the bottom.
Liquid flows from spout A downwards and encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid from spout A continues flowing and is directed downward by another baffle.
The liquid from spout A flows left, passing under another baffle, and reaches container D.
Liquid flows from spout B downwards and is directed to the right by a baffle.
The liquid from spout B hits another baffle and is directed downward.
The liquid from spout B flows left and reaches container E.
Liquid flows from spout C downwards and is directed to the left by a baffle.
The liquid from spout C flows under another baffle, continuing to the left.
The liquid from spout C reaches container E.
Liquid from spout A flows into container D.
Liquids from spouts B and C flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into both containers D and E, with D receiving liquid from A and E receiving liquid from B and C.
